item.title: Authenticating with LDAP
item.description: One feature of the Replicated LDAP integration is the ability for your application containers to authenticate using a simple REST API that runs inside your application environment. When your application container creates an authentication request against the on-prem Replicated API, Replicated will send the request to the identity provider for login and return a success/error response synchronously. For details on using the Identity API in your application, refer to the Indentity API reference documentation.

item.title: LDAP & Identity Integration Overview
item.description: Replicated can be integrated with LDAP servers to sync users and/or authenticate users between the directory and your application. Configuration To enable the identity services in your application, a top level key in your release yaml must be present: identity: enabled: true provisioner: 'https://localhost/ldap/auth' sources: - source: ldap enabled: true Field Description enabled Boolean indicating if LDAP authentication is enabled on this installation.

item.title: Supported LDAP Servers
item.description: Replicated currently supports LDAP Authentication and sync in the following directory servers: Microsoft Active Directory (2008 and 2012) Open LDAP LDAP 389 DS Free IPA
